page.title: 01MID DARENT VALLEY, SHOREHAM
page.content: The River Darent, its valley, and hills east, between the villages of Shoreham and Eynsford, is arable and dairy farmland, but contains some managed deciduous woodland. Crops include wheat, barley, maize, peas, oilseed rape, and the last remaining hop garden in NW Kent. The woodland includes beech, birch, and sweet chestnut which is coppiced in seven year cycles, for use as fencing. The river is approximately 30 metres above sea level, the chalk hills of the North Downs forming a landscape designated as of "Outstanding Natural Beauty", rising to 200 metres on both sides. The A225 road from Sevenoaks to Dartford and the main railway line from Maidstone to London run northwards parallel to the river. Lullingstone Roman Villa excavations and Lullingstone Castle are both open
